KH.content: Derrida less concerned w/ art of Plato [re: mises en abyme of khōra and politics] but in a constraint, a programme, the being-programme of the programme, the being-logical of logic: Plato apprehends them as such, though in a dream, put en abyme

btwn text & theme, structure w/out an indivisible origin > theater of irony, w/out end, w/out bottom [abyss]; to isolate a theme, “philosophy-of-Plato,” would be to violently misrecognize, deny textual scene, questions of topology in general

Platonism, which still can be referred to, would refer to the misprision, the thesis torn out by artifice from written fiction of “Plato,” and, under the name of philosophy, a certain force of thetic abstraction in his texts recommends one to do so
“Platonism” a necessary effect of Plato’s texts has dominated (in name of philosophy) by way of arbitrary violence (making the law) other motifs at work in the text
turns back against the text, w/ a violent reversion that’s always interested & interesting [says same thing about Nietzsche]

“Platonism” not only neutralizes Plato’s texts, inhibiting forces that continue to maintain a certain disorder (parasitism, ventriloquism, clandestinity, tone of denial), “Platonism” commands whole history of this neutralization, a philosophy would always be “Platonic”
what is shown, hidden, won, lost in Plato, w/ Plato?
Plato never qualified khōra as matter (hylè) like Aristotle did

GOD.content: Christian reversal, conversion of Platonism, entrance on scene of a “gift” transforms Good into Goodness that forgets itself, love that renounces itself; this inaccessible source of Goodness means the donee also receives death
irreplaceable singularity of self [command of goodness] requires a death w/ no possible substitution “Death is mine if it is at all” [see p. 45 death creates possibility, p. 46 death is mine]
when Platonism, light or son of Good (invisible source of intelligible visibility) becomes Christian faith (a gaze)

R.content: democracy acc. Plato [in Republic (Book 8)] looks to Derrida like a bazaar, a carnival, pre-capitalist marketplace, complete lack of authority, soft like Orpheus
both Plato & Aristotle maintain political turn toward or salutation of One God, where arkhē has at his disposal tekhnē, for Plato not utopia, prayer, but very difficult

MONL.content: hyperbole is Plato’s word: excess beyond excess > impregnable, epekeina tes ousias

OOG.content: for Plato, wasn’t the eternity of essences another name for nonempirical historicity?

the Idea is not, always “beyond being” (epekeina tes ousias), as Telos of infinite determinability of Being, it’s being’s openness to the light > it is the light of light, sun of the visible sun, a hidden sun, no doubt what a Plato muted by Platonism tells us about
in Husserl there’s a “Platonism” of eidos or Idea not even in Plato (except in literalness of his myths & pedagogy)

LOBL.content: scene of visibility: a primal scene > that which enables us to see should remain invisible, black, blinding [Plato]

MC.content: ever since Plato [repression of Democritus, a large symptom?], an organization of the throw: subject/object > repress chance, repress the mark, protect “normality,” isolate a solid context (stereotomy)

SPOM.content: Marx feigns to count ghosts, they are innumberable, and there is but one ghost (already too many, i.e. supplements), it is # itself, the arch-specter as father as capital or Plato’s good

Marx & Saint Max, heirs to Platonic tradition, associate image w/ specter, idol w/ phantasm, phantasma, eidola (Phaedo, Timaeus): living-dead, figures of dead souls > survival and return of living-dead as essence of the idol

VM.content: for Levinas, sun of epekeina tes ousias (fecundity, generosity) will always illuminate inexhaustible source of thought, Plato places Good beyond Being, beyond light of Being [see p. 312n Descartes’ infinite does this too]; “ex-cendence”
is phenomenology really different from Platonic, metaphysical, idealism? Husserl would say yes, Plato hypostasized idea by not understanding it as noema

PP.content: Derrida recognizes that the cicada myth in Phaedrus also includes question about writing [before the Theuth myth], he asks: “has anyone ever picked up on it?”
Plato presents writing as occult, suspect, power, just like painting, optical illusions, techniques of mimēsis in general > his mistrust for mantic, magic, sorcerers is well known

[Plato’s puritanical auto-immunity] illness as allergy to alien element, “normal” disease defends itself; God cannot have an allergic reaction > perfection and immortality: no relation to outside; but how can we exclude the parasitic supplement, pharmakon?

Plato attacks sophists for the substitution of mnemonic device for live memory, thing for limb, passive, mechanical “by-heart” for active reanimation of knowledge (truth must be distinct from its sign) > Plato dreams of a memory w/ no sign.
opposition btwn mnēmē and hypomnēsis institutes all oppositions of Platonism, the boundary line is major decision of philosophy, maintains, institutes itself, contains its fond advers
pharmakon, older than either of the opposites, “caught (pris)” by philosophy, by “Platonism” > constituted as a mixture of two pure, heterogenous terms
Plato speaks about writing from position of king? while suspecting non-“democratic” politics of writing
Plato prefers one writing over the other, a good writing over bad, a fertile trace (endgenders w/in) over a sterile one (une semence dépensée au-dehors en pure perte, risk of dissemination)
Plato condemns lost or parricidal son while acting like one [?]
Plato moves dividing line btwn presence and trace (ikhnos) to dialectical trace and nondialectical trace: good play and bad play

does Plato give play a chance, to take play seriously is to relieve it of its playfulness; Plato says (in Laws 803b-e) our life should be spent in play (sacrifice, song and dance), play perfectly [telos?]

the 3 eras of “Platonism” (Plato, Saussure, and Rousseau), which put writing out of question while borrowing from it all its demonstrative/theoretical resources, must come to terms w/: 1) generalized sort of writing 2) a “contradiction”: written proposal of logocentrism 3) construction of “literary” work
Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy
[Saussurean moment about relationality of letters in Plato’s Philebus] > “none of us could get to know one of the collection all by itself”
“Platonism” rehearses “family scene” while also trying to master it, to conceal (dissimuler) it by drawing curtains over the dawning of the West
transmission of dialectical mastery of pharmaka from father to son disrupted by family scene that constitutes & undermines passage btwn pharmacy & house
first use of il y a là cendre, in reference to not losing Plato’s 2nd letter, which speaks of what he [Plato?] could never have written

VP.content: absolute ideality is correlate of a possibility of indefinite repetition of the same > being for Husserl is ideality as repetition
tradition assured to infinity > transmission and reactivation of origin; this is a valuation, an ethico-theoretical act, reawakening originary decision of philosophy as Platonic form
via Husserl, Greek metaphysics of presence becomes “modern” metaphysics of presence as self-consciousness, metaphysics of idea as representation (Vorstellung)

S.content: most matutinal in Frühe, of promise, an other birth, other essence, hétérogène à l’origine, foreign to Christianity w/out being opposed to it, even more radically foreign to Platonic metaphysics

FSW.content: Freud augured a beyond and beneath of “Platonic” closure

TC.content: Artaud: Plato must have experienced the streaming naked realization

POOF.content: for Plato, ideal state only occurs when philosopher (that is, justice) is bound to power > though this is out of reach, it must be described, because ideal gives meaning to every term/concept of political philosophy

re: privileged reference to Menexenus (can never absolutely be justified), Derrida explains how deconstruction functions whether Plato is ironic or not, decons. belongs to heritage of Platonic irony > his irony still offers glimpses of mirrors, identities, ‘ideal self’ of the people

DS.content: Hymen: INTER Platonem et Mallarmatum [p. 219n btwn Mallarmé & Hegel]
le double parricide [Plato’s]: Homer (for mimetic poetry), Parmenides (for neglecting mimesis > his logos, the “paternal thesis” would prohibit doubling)
only metaphors of painting and writing are linked to psyche > in “reality,” literally, acc. Plato, writing & painting deal in copies, copies of copies, incapable of intuition of thing itself
idea as presence of what is: Plato, as figure of thing itself; Descartes, as subjective representation; Hegel, as both (still Platonism)
acc. Plato, phantasma is simulacrum as copy of a copy > no longer refers to any ontology or dialectic [but one cannot escape mimetologism in one fell swoop]
Mallarmé’s simulacrum of Plato/Hegel separated from what it imitates w/ barely perceptible veil
Plato would’ve considered undecidability of play, double scene (w/out any dialectical Aufhebung, entr’ouvert), doxa not epistēmē > i.e. eunuch (not man) hitting a bat (not bird) in Republic

POS.content: Democrites’ rhythmos as writing & rhythm, a materialism before Marx [?], repressed, silenced, ontologized by Plato

OS.content: still Platonism in Heidegger’s Verfallen (into time, Being)? > move from primordial to derivative (time) always metaphysical

ROP.content: royal weaver (le tisserand royal) of Platonic dialectic (then Aristotle, Hegel, Kant), belongs to order of ideational consciousness, cannot intervene to remove resistance of any sort

ATIA.content: in Phaedrus, a comparison of the singing cicada w/ the philosophizing man: as a man I am a cicada

FS.content: like structuralism, no concept of force in Husserl (brings phenomenology back to Platonism despite professed anti-Platonism); for Husserl, truth requires forgetting [of genesis, force, failure, crises]

DPi.content: Plato’s Laws (907d-909d) [3 types of impiety (asebia) each divided in 2: atheism, those who believe gods are negligent, those who believe gods can be bribed] > three types of prisons, houses of corrections (i.e. nocturnal assembly)

DST.content: Platonism denounces in mimesis (in désistance) madness, feminization, hysteria

D.content: re: Soller’s Numbers, Plato’s cave contained in an incommensurably, imprévisiblement, more complicated machine
for Plato, Delta (𝚫) most perfect letter [equilateral triangle]

AD.content: acc. Levinas, substitution, the-one-for-the-other (l’un-pour-l’autre) (inscribed in human fraternity), would be unintelligible for Plato—links this response to his parricide of Parmenides

WOG.content: under the sign of difference (Foucault, Deleuze too), ‘We Other Greeks’ displaced/deformed (not reversed) an inherited dialecticism that had a Platonic origin before Hegelian, Marxist dialectic

OG.content: Plato exteriorizes writing as “image” similar to Saussure but has more subtle theory of image/painting
model of Fall (Platonic or Judeo-Christian) can only be stated w/in common closure

IF.content: Flaubert: Plato is very source of ideal

SPEC.content: demon, revenance which repeats its entrance, revient w/out having been called by PP > like Socrates’ demon, which made everyone write, this automaton produces effects of ventriloquism, w/out origin, emission, addressee, tele w/out telos
variation-of-the-trait-in-relation-to-the-object, not only the theme of Symposium but its performance, its condition
Derrida’s limiting the pleasure he can give himself tonight [re: comparison of fort/da to Symposium]
Plato accuses Aristophanes in Apology, Alicibiades defends Socrates in Symposium; Plato is behind Socrates, or in front, as a lawyer: here is the martyr, he’s innocent, he’s judging you
Plato’s mimetico-diagetic narratives begin by stating lacunae, can one take account?
complex scene of signature in which inscription arrives only to erase itself

skepsis, maieutics [in Freud]—division btwn differance & opposition marked in Philebus (12E) > Beyond… in turn becoming supplementary chapter of Philebus, Philebus deciphers it from afar like a teleguided reading device, Philebus reads Beyond…, is lodged in it > this setting adrift is programmed by discourse on apeiron: Socrates’ last word of Philebus: “let go”
PP (the master) is not master > pleasure, the great speculator, calculates w/ effects of aphrodisiac stricture (Socrates wanted nothing to do with proper name of Aphrodite)
